comments.body:
I really don't understand why this change causes https://travis-ci.org/flutter/flutter/jobs/291503341#L3166-L3208

```
  NoSuchMethodError: The method 'call' was called on null.
  Receiver: null
  Tried calling: call("/path/to/main.dart")
  dart:core                                          List.forEach
  package:flutter_tools/src/compile.dart 134:22      ResidentCompiler.recompile

  ===== asynchronous gap ===========================

  ===== asynchronous gap ===========================

```
It seems to be an issue with mocked stdin
Would it make sense to make the same change above on line 111 ?
Do we have to kill the frontend server? Wouldn't sending 'quit' command work more cleanly?

Yeah, `quit` is probably cleaner, but I wanted to avoid handling the case when frontend server got into some weird state - handling that would require sending `quit`, waiting with timeout for server to exit, then killing it. 

We can clean this up after we land this CL.

Arguably, if frontend server can get into weird state so that it doesn't respond to 'quit' command, we would want to know about it now. After all this is test suite that should help us uncover bugs like that.
Cleaning it up later is fine though.
Should the error messages themselves be here too?

Perhaps we can add them here later, if it would make sense to expose them like this.
Currently assumption is that complete compiler output is presented to the user which includes errors/warnings/nits.
